alert.note: Alert for Bulloch; Effingham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 17 at 8:24PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bulloch and Effingham. Portions of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 823 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ridgeland, Springfield, Ebenezer, Stillwell, Clyo, Tillman, Shawnee, Switzerland, Egypt, Berryville, Deerfield, Tusculum, Mitchellville, Ardmore, Okatie, Griffin Lake and Boyd.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
